comments.author: btcfilmmaker
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoHeadlineNews on September 03, 2023, 02:08:57 PMJust as BitcoinGirl.Club just said, A.I such as ChatGPT can do all the script and high-quality article writing for you very fast in a few minutes.Flexclip is a perfect tool for your video creation project, as its capable to help you generate or edit your video to your best of taste.Speechelo.com is a perfect tool to give you a high-quality voiceover for your project, and all you need is just a one-time payment of just $27 and it is all yours, that can still be used for the voiceover of unlimited project.As someone who's worked within the industry for over a decade, and even used AI recently, I would have to disagree.I think AI is a great tool to be utilised by writers but in it's current state, even when you properly take time to set up and train ChatGPT prior to delivering a script, there's still a lot of great flaws. I used it recently as an aide with a short film, whilst it was pretty helpful it kept suggesting very out of character, or out of context dialog or actions - despite being pre-trained with character bios, over arching story, meanings etc, it was still going against all of this occasionally.Flexclip may be good to generate your standard 'stock footage' films - anything else, I wouldn't count on it. Again, it all depends on whom is commissioning the work, if you want something that truly reflects your brand in terms of style, you may want specifics to be followed. For example, you may want it shot on 16mm to have the vintage film look along with a certain colour palette which will be curated by the set designer, costume, prop designer and DoP.Additionally voice overs are still without nuance or emotion, there is a lack of emphasis with delivery. Whilst it can work with your standard socials/reel advert delivery, for anything beyond that with a higher production value - you'll want a professional performer. Do you really think the AI voice you linked sounds good? I personally hate these, and will instantly skip over any ad/content that has these, they sound horrible.
